result.execSummary:
The defendant Daejujuan K Spivey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Daejujuan K Spivey

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay the DNA surcharge,  costs, surcharges and disbursements as ordered.  Should defendant get revoked and sent to prison, Court ordered monies to be taken by the Department of Corrections from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
Court ordered restitution set at zero, as there was none requested.

Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.
Obtain high school diploma, HSED or GED.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.

No contact with Latoya W.
No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with co-actor Terrell Perkins.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
AODA assessment and treatment. Urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work and school, and release to the Day Reporting Center; good time also allowed.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Parker Charles Mathers in court, defendant Daejujuan K Spivey not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Release Conditions Order, signed and filed.
TOT to Justice Point, with no drugs or alcohol; no firearms or weapons. No Contact Order remains in effect.

Attorney Parker Charles Mathers in court, defendant Daejujuan K Spivey not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $1,000.00 CASH.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date.  Court ordered case adjourned before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 03/03/2015 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF850 (14 Pages).

Defendant Daejujuan K Spivey in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Daejujuan K Spivey in custody. Ron Dague for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Detective Tracy Becker. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.    
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Latoya W.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daejujuan K Spivey in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  
Defendant Daejujuan K Spivey in custody.  
Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
